Kyle Hendricks threw 7 1/3 scoreless innings in the Cubs' 3-0 win against the Reds.
The Cincinnati Reds were shut out for the second consecutive game by the Chicago Cubs, losing 3-0.
Kyle Hendricks tossed 7 1/3 shutout innings while holding the Cincinnati Reds to only two hits in a 3-0 victory.
Kyle Hendricks, who has struggled much of the year, dominated the Reds lineup, allowing just one hit through five innings.

Isaac Paredes lined a single into center to push the first run of the day across the plate for the Cubs.

Justin Wilson allowed an inherited runner to score and was charged with two additional runs after allowing all three batters he faced to reach base.
